actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Government Operations.

official_title: A bill to require certain Federal agencies to analyze complaints regarding their delivery of services and benefits and report their findings to Congress.

summary.text: Agency Accountability Act--Requires specified agencies of the Federal Government to report annually to Congress the number of written complaints received by such agency from a Member of Congress regarding any difficulty experienced by any person with respect to such agency, whether such complaint was resolved, and the time required to complete such resolution.

titles.title: A bill to require certain Federal agencies to analyze complaints regarding their delivery of services and benefits and report their findings to Congress.
